pages.text: As one progresses with the research on deities, a question might come up: "What do I even get from doing all this work? And how do I even use it?"$(br)Good question, occultist!$(br)Generally, a deity is used by creating $(marked)Symbols$() or advanced $(marked)Statues$().$(br)These are powered with $(marked)Occult Energy$().

These symbols and statues use occult energy when their $(marked)hour$() begins, which can be viewed with the $(item)Splendorous Eye$().$(br)Deities can have different effects, which are usually stronger in statues than in symbols, and which are usually only active during the matching hour.

When used with a Splendorous Eye, a deity (as in, a symbol or a statue) will automatically  be bound to the nearest Nexus. This will cause it to supply an aspect to it (when the hour is matching), given that it has any aspects bound to it. Deities can also be bound to blocks like $(l:energy/entry_core)Occult Energy Cores$(), meaning that they can drain and be drained, depending on what the user desires (see according entry).

Generally, whenever a deity supplies an potion effect, an aspect, or something else, OE must be used. Otherwise, it will have no effect.$(br2)The upgraded $(o)statues$() are, as already said, more efficient. They can also be prayed to, which generally is done by interacting with it. If praying is possible, this will usually apply interesting effects.
